Classics: The study of the languages, literatures, and cultures of ancient Greece and Rome.
Comparative & World Literature: The study of literature across national, linguistic, and cultural boundaries.
East Asian Languages & Cultures: The study of the languages and cultures of China, Japan, and Korea.
French & Italian: The study of the languages, literatures, and cultures of the French- and Italian-speaking worlds.
Germanic Languages & Literatures: The study of the languages and cultures of the Germanic, Scandinavian, and Yiddish-speaking worlds.
Linguistics: The scientific study of human language, its structure, use, and cognitive basis.
Religion: The academic and interdisciplinary study of religious traditions and phenomena.
Slavic Languages & Literatures: The study of the languages, literatures, and cultures of Russia and Eastern Europe.
Spanish & Portuguese: The study of the languages, literatures, and cultures of the Spanish- and Portuguese-speaking worlds.
